string.value: Speak nicely and be nice.
Trash talk and other abusive language while playing will result in bans.
No MapleStory administrator will ever ask for your password.
Don't tell anyone else your password!
Please contact Customer Support on the MapleStory homepage to report bugs.
Head to the official MapleStory website to see your rankings.
Participating in illegal activities, such as hacking, while playing will get you banned.
Use the system options in the menu to adjust the game sounds.
Use the game options in the menu to toggle ON/OFF chatting, trade, whisper, and other functions.
Type '/?' or '/help' to see more about '/' commands.
Some cash items can be deleted by donating them to the Clothes Collector.
To gift a cash item, simply select 'Purchase' -> 'Give Gift', then enter the name of the character you want to gift it to.
To prevent hacking, be careful about what attachments you open from e-mails or instant messages.
Some cash items can be exchanged once before being used with Personal Shops or Hired Merchants.
To use items purchased in the Cash Shop, you must double-click them to add them to your in-game Inventory first.
Karma Koin cards can be purchased from most major retailers.
Using macro (automatic hunting) programs can result in disconnections and bans against your Maple ID without warning.
Mesos and items cannot be duplicated. Please be wary of item fraud.
Please be aware that playing for too long may be harmful to your health.
You cannot get compensation for the restrictions you get from using illegal programs.
Please use valid information when you create your Nexon account.
Please refer to the MapleStory homepage if you need customer support at any time.
Please change your Nexon ID password and Maple ID password regularly to help protect your account.
You can use Duey's Delivery System to send items or mesos to other players.
If you're on a public PC, please check the security programs and use your personal PC later to change your passwords.
Please be extra careful not to enter your ID and password outside of the official website.
Using illegal programs and unauthorized websites may put you at risk for hacking.
We recommend you use a combination of letters and numbers that are hard to predict for your password.
Party leaders can right-click on any other player and click 'Invite to Party' to send them an invite.
Right-click on other players and use the Fame +/- feature to make them more, or less, famous!
Fame can be changed only once a day! You can fame or defame a particular character once a month.
Type '/Trade CharacterName' to open the Trade Window.
Some classes may not always be available for creation.
Try Monster Life, another fun element of MapleStory!
Please look under the Guide section and on the official forums if you have any questions about the game.
Use shortcut keys (I, E, S, K, W, M, R, H) to easily open menus.
Find and use hidden portals in the map.
Press F1-F7 to express various emotions.
Use portals to move to other areas.
Portals to other areas are displayed in the Minimap as blue circles.
Press the Details button to see your stats in more detail.
All player characters will be shown as red dots on the Minimap.
Standing still restores your HP.
Press Z to pick up items on the ground, or you can set your own Pick Up key in the Key Settings.
Press the Ctrl key to attack and the Alt key to jump.
You can buy equipment and potions for your adventure from NPC shops in the game.
You can distribute the AP you earn when you gain a level in the Stats window.
You cannot switch to different job after your 1st Job Advancement.
Double-click an equipment item in your Inventory window, or drag it into the Equip window to equip it.
Press W to open the World Map.
Press E to open the Equip window.
Press I to open the Inventory window to see the items you own.
Press M to open the Minimap.
Press K to open the Skill window.
Press S to look at your character's stats.
Press R to look at information about your friends, party, and guild.
You can take a Job Advancement at level 10.
If you level up after you take a Job Advancement, you will receive Skill Points.
There is a shop in every town where you can purchase equipment and potions.
Some items can only be used by a certain gender or class. Double-check before you buy!
Be careful! Death will cause you to lose some EXP after you take your job advancement.
Completing quests will earn you items you can't find in shops.
Passive Skills begin working automatically as soon as you learn them.
To use Active skills faster, drag the icon from the Skill window into one of your quickslots.
Each town sells unique equipment.
Distribute Skill Points in the Skills window.
Be careful! Powerful monsters dwell in the underground dungeons.
Defeating more powerful monsters will earn you treasures not found in any shop.
MP recovers little by little after a set amount of time has passed.
Skills that cost MP cannot be used without MP.
Return Scrolls will get you back to town and back into action much faster than walking.
If you run out of Stars and Bullets, they will not disappear from your inventory.
Keep up your Star and Bullet supplies at the Weapon/General Stores in each Town.
During the 2nd Job Advancement, Explorer Warriors can pick between Fighter, Page, and Spearman.
During the 2nd Job Advancement, Explorer Bowmen can pick between Hunter and Crossbowman.
During the 2nd Job Advancement, Explorer Magicians can pick between Wizard and Cleric.
During the 2nd Job Advancement, Explorer Thiefs can pick between Assassin and Bandit.
During the 2nd Job Advancement, Explorer Pirates can pick between Brawler and Gunslinger.
Use the sauna in Sleepywood to recover HP and MP faster.
There are some skills that will not stack with other skills.
Use a variety of skills to beef up your weapons and armor!
Some quests and items have a Fame requirement.
The Magician's 2nd Job Skills will increase your Magic Attack, but the damage will vary with each monster.
There are some quests that can be completed multiple times.
Some 4th Job skills require Mastery Books to upgrade.
Some quests will earn you new 4th Job skills.
Some 4th Job skill quests require specific starting conditions. Keep an eye out!
Some items can only be used by a certain gender or class. Double-check before you buy!
You can dash by pressing > -> or < <-.
Speak nicely and be nice.
Trash talk and other abusive language while playing will result in bans.
No MapleStory administrator will ever ask for your password.
Don't tell anyone else your password!
Please contact Customer Support on the MapleStory homepage to report bugs.
Head to the official MapleStory website to see your rankings.
Participating in illegal activities, such as hacking, while playing will get you banned.
Use the system options in the menu to adjust the game sounds.
Some cash items can be deleted by donating them to the Clothes Collector.
To gift a cash item, simply select 'Purchase' -> 'Give Gift', then enter the name of the character you want to gift it to.
To prevent hacking, be careful about what attachments you open from e-mails or instant messages.
To use items purchased in the Cash Shop, you must double-click them to add them to your in-game Inventory first.
Karma Koin cards can be purchased from most major retailers.
Using macro (automatic hunting) programs can result in disconnections and bans against your Maple ID without warning.
Mesos and items cannot be duplicated. Please be wary of item fraud.
Please be aware that playing for too long may be harmful to your health.
You cannot get compensation for the restrictions you get from using illegal programs.
Please use valid information when you create your Nexon account.
Please refer to the MapleStory homepage if you need customer support at any time.
Please change your Nexon ID password and Maple ID password regularly to help protect your account.
If you're on a public PC, please check the security programs and use your personal PC later to change your passwords.
Please be extra careful not to enter your ID and password outside of the official website.
Using illegal programs and unauthorized websites may put you at risk for hacking.
We recommend you use a combination of letters and numbers that are hard to predict for your password.
Party leaders can right-click on any other player and click 'Invite to Party' to send them an invite.
Right-click on other players and use the Fame +/- feature to make them more, or less, famous!
Fame can be changed only once a day! You can fame or defame a particular character once a month.
Some classes may not always be available for creation.
Please look under the Guide section and on the official forums if you have any questions about the game.
You cannot trade with others in Reboot World.
